Quote_Content: I’m too exhausted to explain my soul to someone again.
How could I leave you when I love you so?
Not only was her soul exuberant, but her thoughts mirrored the delight in her heart.
Why did you say you loved me when you didn’t?
I wouldn’t love you if I didn’t aspire to be something you are.

I cannot see the softness of your neck nor the space in which my head nestles
between your chin and your shoulder, resting on your rising, falling
chest as I kiss your collarbones begging your lips to tell me, ‘You’re the one.’
I am the happiest and saddest I have ever been.
With every word, you broke me.
But my love knows no end.
I want to be in love.
You must know I feel nothing but love for you.
I am so lonely without you.
A thousand poems would not suffice.
My soul longs for you.
I’m in love with you and it hurts too much.

‘Why do you hesitate so?’ he asks.

'Some days,’ she sighs, 'the trepidation of losing you overwhelms me so much that I cannot even remember why I love you so much in the first place.’
I vividly remember our parting moments: our last kiss in my room, leaving you behind on the sidewalk, hoping you would get over me, hoping I would get over you.
I am counting the days since I last saw you.
i chose poetry / over honesty / then lived this unremarkable life.

Ask him about his favourite memory. Remember it. It’s important. It might not make sense at first but it will with time. The more you get to know a person the more their favourite things become self-explanatory.
